sequestrate.translation[0].definitions[0: to take property away from the person it belongs to because they have not paid their debts
sequestrate.translation[1].definitions[0: to officially take property, goods etc away from someone because they have not paid their debts or have broken some other law
The shares were sequestered by the court at the request of the chairman.
They obtained a private injunction to sequester $796.2 million of company assets.
